intro: Lophanthus cusickii, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. Lophanthus cusickii is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes.
